definition: a staff/a rod/cane/walking stick/to flog with a stick (old)

sentences.english: Sears are the price of scepters.
They will be ruled by you with a rod of iron; they will be broken like a potter's vessel.
sentences.chinese: 你必以鐵杖將他們粉碎，就如同打破陶匠的瓦器”。

sentences.english: You will rule them with an iron scepter;
The latter, as if he had seen his intention, turned towards Durward with mace uplifted;
sentences.chinese: 那“野豬”似乎看清了他的意圖，便舉起鐵杖迎戰。

sentences.english: She gave birth to a son, a male child, who will rule all the nations with an iron scepter.
sentences.chinese: 婦人生了一個男孩，是將來要用鐵杖轄管萬國的。

sentences.english: Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron, and shalt break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.
sentences.chinese: 你必以鐵杖將他們粉碎，就如同打破陶匠的瓦器。

sentences.english: He will rule them with an iron scepter .
sentences.chinese: 他會用鐵杖管轄他們的。

sentences.english: He will rule them with an iron scepter.
